headline: Sources and acknowledgments

parts.headline: Homeland Economics
parts.description: Governments across the world are rediscovering industrial policy. They are making a big mistake, argues Callum Williams

parts.headline: Video: Busting globalisation myths
parts.description: How our correspondent followed his hunch about protectionism

parts.headline: Governments across the world are discovering “homeland economics”
parts.description: But introducing industrial policy is a big mistake, argues Callum Williams

parts.headline: Attempts to make supply chains “resilient” are likely to fail
parts.description: And they are likely to be costly

parts.headline: “Homeland economics” will make the world poorer
parts.description: Industrial policy and protectionism could endanger trade, without making Western economies safer

publication.headline: Homeland Economics
publication.description: Governments across the world are rediscovering industrial policy. They are making a big mistake, argues Callum Williams

parts.headline: Governments across the world are discovering “homeland economics”
parts.description: But introducing industrial policy is a big mistake, argues Callum Williams

parts.headline: Attempts to make supply chains “resilient” are likely to fail
parts.description: And they are likely to be costly

parts.headline: “Homeland economics” will make the world poorer
parts.description: Industrial policy and protectionism could endanger trade, without making Western economies safer

parts.headline: New industrial policies will make the world more unequal
parts.description: Workers in the developing world will especially lose out

parts.headline: Green protectionism comes with big risks
parts.description: Some analysts worry that new laws could slow the green transition

parts.headline: New industrial policies will not help economic stability
parts.description: Globalisation has not been perfect but it has been effective

parts.headline: Video: Busting globalisation myths
parts.description: How our correspondent followed his hunch about protectionism
